page.title: 14YSGOL LLANNEFYDD SCHOOL
page.content: Llannefydd county primary was built in 1954.There has also been a Britanic School and a Church School in the village.There are two classrooms in the school a hall/dining room,kitchen, staffroom and toilets.The school is heated by an oil burner in the cellar. There are 36 full-time pupils in the school & 12 part-time nursery pupils. Mr Wynne, the headteacher,was himself a pupil here 20 years ago, he teaches the 7-11 year olds and Mrs Lloyd the 4-7 year olds. Mrs Salusbury has been cook for 24 years and nearly all the children stay for dinner.Milk is sold during mid-morning break. Welsh is the first language of the school and new children are given extra Welsh lessons.Children go from here to Ysgol Glan Clwyd,St Asaph or Denbigh High School.There is plenty of playing area and we keep 4 sheep and 6 hens.
